description.en:
The aim of this course is to learn how to implement cryptographic primitives efficiently and to analyze them by considering basic implementation attacks. This course will include materials from introduction to cryptography and algorithms. 
In this course, we review the arithmetic operations in finite fields/groups such as modular reduction, multiplication, inversion, and exponentiation. We give the implementation details of the algorithms for the integer/polynomial arithmetic in the finite fields/groups by considering efficiency and timing attacks. Then, we implement the cryptosystems by considering efficiency and basic timing attacks. We discuss open-source cryptographic libraries in terms of efficiency and security. 
The course covers the following topics: open-source cryptographic libraries, algorithms to implement finite field/group arithmetic, symmetric key cryptosystems, public-key encryption, key exchange, elliptic curve arithmetic, lattice-based cryptography.
description.et:
Selle kursuse eesmärk on õppida krüptoprimitiive tõhusalt rakendama ja neid analüüsima, võttes arvesse põhilisi teostusründeid. See kursus sisaldab materjale sissejuhatusest krüptograafiasse ja algoritmidesse.
Sellel kursusel käsitleme aritmeetilisi tehteid lõplikes korpustes/rühmades, nagu näiteks jäägi leidmine mooduli järgi, modulaarne korrutamine, pöördelemendi leidmine ja astendamine. Anname täisarvude/polünoomide aritmeetika algoritmide rakendamise üksikasjad lõplikes korpustes/rühmades, võttes arvesse tõhusust ja ajastusrünnakuid. Seejärel viime  krüptosüsteemid ellu, võttes arvesse tõhusust ja põhilisi ajastusrünnakuid. Arutame avatud lähtekoodiga krüptoteeke  tõhususe ja turvalisuse mõttes.
Kursusel käsitletakse järgmisi teemasid: avatud lähtekoodiga krüptograafilised teegid, lõpliku korpuse aritmeetika realiseerimise algoritmid, modulaarne aritmeetika, asenduspermutatsioonivõrk, plokkšifrid, räsifunktsioonid, avaliku võtme krüpteerimine, võtmevahetuse/kapseldamise mehhanismid, elliptilise kõvera aritmeetika, võrepõhine krüptograafia.

objectives.en: The scope of this course includes:
We will study the implementations of cryptosystems.
We will define the finite field arithmetic (modular reduction, multiplication, exponentiation, etc.) at the algorithmic level, which is needed to implement cryptosystems.
objectives.et: Määratleme algoritmilisel tasemel lõpliku korpuse  aritmeetika (modulaarne redutseerimine, korrutamine, astendamine jne), mida on vaja krüptosüsteemide realiseerimiseks.

objectives.en: We will give efficient implementation methods.
We will discuss the complexity, performance, and cost of the algorithms to implement the cryptosystems.
objectives.et: Arutame krüptosüsteemide juurutamiseks kasutatavate algoritmide keerukust, jõudlust ja maksumust.

objectives.en: We will introduce open-source cryptographic libraries.
We will give basic countermeasures for the implementation-level (timing) attacks.
objectives.et: Anname põhilised vastumeetmed teostustaseme (ajastamisel põhinevate) rünnakute jaoks.

objectives.en: This course will involve reading and writing mathematical proofs and programming. We will explain the necessary mathematical background in the course.
objectives.et: See kursus hõlmab matemaatiliste tõestuste lugemist ja kirjutamist ning programmeerimist. Vajaliku matemaatilise tausta seletame  kursusel lahti.

topic.en: Mathematical background: number theory, abstract algebra, finite fields/rings, definitions in cryptography (encryption/decryption, key exchange, key encapsulation mechanism, digital signature)
Binary field arithmetic, polynomial multiplication and block ciphers: s-boxes, permutation layers, SPN, binary field extensions
Advanced Encryption Standard and its implementations (look-up-table, arithmetic operations)
Hash functions, SHA-3 Standard: Permutation-Based Hash and Extendable-Output Functions
Extended Euclidean algorithm, integer multiplication algorithms
Modular exponentiation algorithms for RSA encryption/digital signature and Diffie-Hellman (DH) key exchange, implementations of RSA and DH key exchange
Basic attacks and countermeasures for RSA and DH key exchange
Prime field arithmetic, integer multiplication, inversion
Elliptic curve arithmetic, point addition, point multiplication, elliptic curve (EC) DH key exchange, EC digital signature algorithm
Post-quantum cryptography libraries, lattice-based primitives, rounding operations, modular arithmetic, matrix-vector product
